result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad E Spieler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution and surcharges to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Mental Health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by the Agent.
No contact with Twin Flowers, Home Decor and Popular Creek Gardens or their owners.
Undergo Compulsive Counseling.

Condition Time - With Huber. After 15 days then 180 days on Day Report.
60 days huber - STAYED, to be used at Agent's discretion as well as to the huber or straight time.

Day Report Center Direct Court Notification Report; Defendant successfully completed program.

DRC Informational Court Report; status update.

Reviewed by Judge Maxwell.
Order denying defendant's pro se request for the removal of the DNA surcharge.
dated 5/12/16 filed by defendant requesting waiver for DNA surcharge.
Defendant's Huber privileges are hereby revoked until he is deemed stable enough for housing at the Huber facility.

From Waukesha County Jail, Michael Giese, Jail Administrator dated 2/10/16 requesting Huber privileges be revoked until defendant is deemed stable enough to be transferred to Huber.

Approved by Judge Maxwell 2/12/16
4 letters
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Chad E Spieler in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea as to counts 1 and 2. Counts 3 and 4 are dsimissed and read-in. Victims presents statements to the court.  Court imposed the the following sentence:

  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   AS TO EACH COUNT

9 months jail consecutive

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEAR(S);

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
 
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
*No contact with:  Twin Flowers  & Home Decor or Popular Creek Gardens or the owners
*Undergo Compulsive Counseling 
*Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

RESTITUTION:  $794.04 (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines);

COURT COSTS:  $243.00 as to each count (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00 as to each count (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DRGOD:  $10.00 as to ech count (to be paid as condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME: 15 days huber then 180 days of Day Report and
60 days huber, STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.  

Sentence to commence 02/05/2016 by 6 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 01-28-2016 03:00 pm

Defendant Chad E Spieler in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is requesting a plea and sentencing date. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 28, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Hearing at 12-07-2015 10:30 am

Defendant Chad E Spieler in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment for the defendant to complete some counseling. Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Hearing at 11-04-2015 03:00 pm

Defendant Chad E Spieler in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kershek acknowledges discovery, pretrial offer and criminal complaint received.  Hearing scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Petition for appointment of counsel unsigned.
